medium: Nickel-plated and enameled brass, steel, letherette, composite bellows
title: Camera
text: Teague's striking cubist camera and box design is a reflection of the period's artistic trends.  It is also an example of the more geometric, early phase of Art Deco, which designers largely abandoned in favor of the sinuous streamlining that characterized most American products in the 1930s and 1940s.
creditline: The Modernism Collection, gift of Norwest Bank Minnesota
